reviews.review_msg: Although not the most comprehensible instructor, everything's relatively easy to follow and learn. Go to all the classes, take notes, review them and you'll do fine. It's sad how someone thinks it's the teachers' problem that they received a bad grade. Her course is pretty easy, and if you don't attend class 'cuz of her accent, that's your problem.
THe instructor is generous and she tries her best to teach the course. However, if you are taking this course as mark booster PLEASE DONT TAKE IT!!!
A very good teacher concerning students' learning status

Do not take her.She is not a native speaker, and has a difficult time pronouncing the words/sounds, and then she tests you on the words that aren't even pronounced correctly. Guess what, she will mark it incorrect too.She acts nice, but is stern with her marking.How can u teach English/linguistics if you can't even speak the language properly?hmmm
She is very kind and understanding teacher. As long as you attend every classes and participate fully then it should be pretty easy.If you want to take ling 130, I totally recommend her!

A very helpful and friendly prof who is obviously very keen about her field! Has well organized lectures including slides (notes available online). Takes student feedback into consideration by modifying the course. Funny and enjoyable, makes learning the material interesting and attainable! Definitely one of the Linguistic faculties BEST! Try her!
Projects can be time-consuming. Tests are alright, just need to familiarize yourself with symbols and terminologies. Go to every class! She doesn't like ppl who skip...

An easy course, but you must go to every class and will do better if you are good at English. Extremely boring teacher with hard midterms, but projects are VERY easy. This course is pretty easy, but its very hard to pay attn because she is so boring. Last but not least, do NOT turn on your cellphone!!! She will go nuts.

I love her, she is really nice and helpful! You might not her constant pausing in a sentence, but she is a great prof...I would totally recommend anyone who wants to or have to take ling 130 to take her class....Her presentations are fun as well!!!
Nice and very helpful. She uses very organized powerpoints so you don't even have to read the textbook. Ling 130 is a hard course but with this prof it's not too bad.
Well, she made Ling 130 difficult... perhaps that's because she used a combination of Ling 130 and Ling 330's materials.
boring prof & uselesss lectures. didn't prepare us well at all for the midterms. assignments should be weighted more cuz they are quite time consuming.....
she doesn't know how to teach, but she tries hard and is nice. the class is super boring and dry, and she just makes it ten times worse.
Nice pro! really helpful and organized

I had the pleasure of attending his class back in '03 and he was a real inspiration to me then an d still to this day. His humour is sometimes lost on some students but don't worry you'll pick it up by the end of the semester.

Dr. Roberts was my prof over ten years ago and he is still one who stands out. Funny. Caring. Challenging. Willing to consider revising grades. Genuine interest in students. Taught me a big lesson on exam writing.

I took his Winter 06 course and he sure does mumble a lot and is off track with his British jokes. His unclarity could be clarified through his confusing notes. If you approach the method of studying his notes/memorizing, you'll do fine. He boosted me from C+ to B shows that participating pays off. I enjoyed his class others didn't. your decision!

If you like critical analysis on things, he is a great prof. However his comments sometimes lack focus and can make things quite confusing. This makes the course feel harder than it actually is. But the grading at the end is fair and rather generous. He's also a humorous and fun character.
No Comments

Honestly, he's really confusing. Study his confusing notes, and go to all lectures (attendence counts in the end). My experience of this class wasn't too great due to the weather condition and school closures. He had to cancel one of the exams. I wouldn't say his office hrs were helpful. Grade boosters (particpation points).
He needs to teach in such a way that is not confusing for students to undrestand him. Also, it would be better if he spoke more clearly and enunciated his words.

Very Philosophical.  Promotes and encourages free thinking but can make this first year corse VERY confusing. Talks a lot about abstract things.  Exams are easy if you understand lectures.  Does not follow the text for this course.

This prof delivers a learning experience beyond the course material. Students may succeed in this course by treating his midterms as take-home exams using the given topics as questions, memorize the appropriate notes as answers, and practice writing those answers in under 40 minutes.
encourages discussion and questions during class. very nice prof. exams are easy.

Well, in response to below, you dont need the past midterms to get an A. Just visit him every other week to catch up on material, copy down what he says in office hours, there is a lot of stuff that isn't realli clarified in class, very nice prof though, although be prepared to be questioned

acutally, i think he's a great prof. he's a really nice guy who wants his students to do well! his tests are fair and are well related to his lectures.  he might not be so clear in lectures, but the material itself is not so bad. quite interesting when you get it! =) enjoyed this 3 hr lecture class!
best proff i could possibly have had for 130; at first a bit intimidating & a little strange, but turned out to be a very brain stimulating, interactive, informational class!
if you don't have the past exams, don't take his course! Don't think you can get an A or even a B by just studying hard. Actually study won't help, only past exams do.

Absolutely amazing.  At first I thought "what an old fart, too much philosophy", but his love for theory and seemingly off-topic discussions quickly rubbed off.  He taught us to think outside the box and question all the principles of linguistic

He is a really funny guy but he doesn't explain well.  You have no clue about what's the most important thing in the lecture.  The class materials are very boring and not practical at all.  However, he is very knowledgable in this field.
he's a nice prof, but it's hard to understand the materials...don't bother buying the text, it's useless...and get past midterms, those helps A LOT.

The course is hard. His teaching is not very good. I'm just glad that I studied my friend's past exams, so I did quite good on the exams. Without the past exams, I wouldn't know how to pass the course!

his tests aren't too difficult if you know the material and actually study for them. i didn't have the previous exams to look at and i still did well in the class. don't buy the text cuz it's useless & waste of $$, just use the prof's notes to study.
Must have previous exam to do well..  Extremely picky maker.  He will take marks off for the slightest error..  Thinks he is humorous, but is not.  Poor attitude towards students.

A very mean and fake Prof.. Plays favoritism and only like women in class..His exams are 100%  recycled from previous semester.  Must go to his office hour every weeks to suck up in order to get a good mark!!

Excellent Prof! You are guaranteed to learn a lot in his class. He is engaging and he is one of the few Profs at the 100 level that encourages you to think (not regurgitate) and be critical of the material.

An ok class, but one of the worst professors ever.  She would not admit to making a mistake in answering a simple pronunciation question, even though it was obvious to any English-as-a-first-language speaker that she was dead wrong.  Give me a break.

Several mature students (over 30) have found this professor to be rude, arrogant, and unapproachable.  She was not willing to answer their questions in class and favoured the younger students.  This is blatant discrimination based on age.
She gives fair and easy midterms and finals. If you know your stuff, you will get an A for sure.
Yet another professor with genuine interest and passion for their subject, Zita McRobbie made the dry material entertaining and interesting.  Very helpful, especially in office hours.
She is very good at explaining things, and holds everyone's attention well.  Never wastes time, and sometimes brings you lollypops.  Shushes people a lot though *dum dee dum*
The best prof ever.  Clear, organized, and cares about students who try hard.  Wonderful experience.
She gave us a lot of feedbacks and practices. She is just great!!
such a great prof that i ever met.. she knows her stuff.. and you got to learn a lot from her class.
don't buy the text book. study her notes and study guide. it's not an easy course. don't leave everything til the last minute then you should be fine

TAKE ling 130 with her. she's such an eaasy prof and the nicest too!!Her take home assignments are easy to do and if you ask her in office hours, she'll help you! midterms are easy too...just read the notes and you'll get over 90 %! p.s. Dont' buy text
